review: I started playing Overwatch in season 10 on Xbox and since then the game has lost it's touch. The change in leadership has caused the game to lose it's identity and it doesn't excel at anything it tries to implement. The game does everything it can to squeeze as much money out of the player as possible while also balancing the game as minimally as possible. I am hoping with the xbox buy-out they will have the freedom of developing a good game but at the moment the game is only fun if you are a longtime player or are you are willing to spend an outrageous amount of money.

OVERWATCH LEAGUE IS DYING BLESS THE LORD

I have played this game since the first overwatch 1 open beta. I had been hyped for this game since the first trailer. This game on launch was the best competitive FPS on the market for its time. Pushing the limits of what a team shooter was. Over the course of Overtwatch post release. I put thousands of hours of my time into the game. While originally playing the game for fun, i found myself improving to the point where I had begun participating with open division teams and getting to 4300+ SR on accounts before role queue came out as a hitscan player. I was there for every patch, meeting new people, pushing myself competitively in tournaments with people that at the time i could call my good friends while we spent easily 50+ hours a week playing and improving. watching our POVs, scrimming, and doing whatever was best to be the players. This was a game I was happy to grind at the time enjoyed as I wanted to eventually reach the point of GosuGamers and eventually Contenders/OWL once that was started. Even when i stopped as a player I still found myself doing coaching for players and even managing of a T3 team for a short period.

However, this was years ago at this point. After months, the blizzard polish wore off the cracks and flaws of the game would show. While the Dev team has a lot going against them internally, they still failed to create changes to the game that benefit its players or to improve the game. On the contrary, the dev-team actively hurt the game. We went weeks and months with stale patches. Countless new heroes additions, maps, and balance changes that further created an unfun experience for everyone in the game. A majority of the release heroes were fine, even in some niche cases like mei, she still had obvious ways to play against that felt fair. Ana was the only post release hero that felt like an overall good thing for the game. Her sleep, while one of the strongest CC tools we have seen, was balanced around being a 'hard' to aim projectile that could be interupted by anyone accidently waking up a target. It was fair. Other heroes, Sombra, Moira, Orisa, Doomfist, etc. While cool and interesting and had their issues. Which in any game could have been fine, the devs would have done or tweaked these new heroes eventually. This was sadly not the reality for overwatch. Heroes like Brigitte and Sigma were troublesome heroes for MONTHS. Just those two heroes alone tranisitioned METAs into GOATs and doubleshield. Meta shifts are fine, but these were MONTHS if not years of problematic issues that the balance team could never solve. 

This problem of being unable to create a positive change lead the dev team to attempt multiple rash decisions due to their inability to properly change the game. GOATs became an issue due to the strength of Brigitte's utility and the value that tanks could have over picking DPS. Instead of making radical changes to try and change up the meta, they threw in the towel and introduced 2/2/2-rolequeue. Now, this obviously fixed the issue of GOATs, but it felt like a band-aid fix. Sure, GOATs was definitely strong but i never felt that attempted any major changes to target the team composition due to fear of targeting players to make them feel weak. (Personally i loved GOATs btw, it was one of the most technical metas we had and individually each player held so much strength to improve from GM-top500 mechanically in this meta. the main people that hated GOATs was ironically the flex-dps players that were stuck on brig.)

Then it was sigma with double shield right after. The near impenetrable shields of Sigma/Orisa would wreak havoc. The fast paced way of playing GOATs was replaced by a shooting shield sim. Sadly, the dev team again showed they were unable to make any significant change to the meta. This is what lead overwatch 2 to be a 5v5 game instead. Losing the possibility of Reinhardt/Zarya comps is one of the saddest decisions to happen to this game. Every major change that effected gameplay has only further limited the game.

Not to mention Blizzards fear of reworking or touching problematic heroes for months. It took MONTHs to convince the devs during launch that hey, maybe having a mass-revive on a support hero. Leading to camping inside the spawn room to wait for ults on 2cp maybe wasnt the best choice. 

But this was all overwatch 1, the dev team worked to improve overwatch 2 right? They had put ow1 on life support, leaving players with a huff of copium every few months to keep our spirits up. So what came to ow2 after leaving the existing players left to rot?

While heroes were reworked, to remove CC and PVE to look out for, Everyone was hyped for OW2. Even at the time it made no sense to re-release the game outside of money reasons but that was put to the aside, excited for what was to come. and what came?

- We lost 6v6 for 5v5 due to failure of the dev team to balance. We lost the possibility of many compositions and interactions because the team couldn't figure out balance. Reinhardt/zarya - Winston/D.VA - Orisa/Sigma. All iconic tank compositions just gone from ever existing again

- We lost many features from OW1 - on fire, previous season data, loot boxes. some of this is still being RE-added into OW2.

- we LOST the PVE originally promised, shown and that was playable. For 4 years, the dev team worked on something that never existed, and even though they knew they were no longer providing on their original promises. The dev team kept it behind doors that PVE was trashed in what was promised for the watered down PVE experience that we had already played X amount of times. the Replay-ability heavily reduced, and player freedom was gone.

- After Blizzard killed HOTS pro circuit around the rise of OWL, they just killed it recently as well, with a mass-layoff of people I had known or interacted with previously.

- We lost 2cp for a gamemode thats just as frustrating. Teams were punished for winning the first fight due to counter picking on 2nd fight. Losing the possibility to gain momentum due to losing ults % or forced into playing in an unfavorable comp.

- Skins that were in the game since release were re-slapped with a price tag. the only fully functional thing in overwatch 2 was the battlepass and shop. The battlepass would also lock new heroes behind a slow grind for free players.

The steam release is not a decision to get more players but only for the money so that execs that see theyre in the green in their quarterly calls. Blizzard is no longer the company that has the players best interest at heart, only its shareholders. I feel bad for the Devs that put blood sweat and tears into their games just for them to be shells and forgotten relics of the time where they used to be and I hope they are able to transition to other companies successfully. I hope that OW and other blizzard IPs can make a turnaround eventually. But in the current state, i do not recommend OW2. There are better alternatives at this time for both casual and hardcore competitive players.

downloaded just to say this game SUX. put a good thousand or so hours into the game when it was relevant (and called Overwatch instead of Overwatch 2); it was a troubled game then and it's absolute garbage now. the focus on trying to consensus crack and engineer an esport made them suck every last bit of fun out of the game that was already comparable in entertainment to shoving carnivorous earwigs into each of your ears at the same time. don't buy the battlepass, or bundles, spend your cash on just about anything else.

Let me preface this review by saying I dont care about the PvE. I dont care about the lies, the broken promises or the years of content drought. God knows enough of the other reviews have that covered.


Why I didnt I care? Because for the 2000ish hours I played of it, it was consistently fun. OW got me through lockdown and helped me retrain my fine motor control when my nervous system went all cattywumpus one time.


>'Was consistently fun'.
>[b]Was.[/b]


[h3]Every set of hero/ability adjustments (we'll not call it balancing) since roughly the launch of Rammatra has made the game worse and less fun without exception.[/h3] 


Ram's design was questionable - he feels great to play but is fundamentally unbalanced being over-versatile, making both sigma & rein permanently redundant. Never mind the ultimate, which was so obviously stupid in it's launch state it raises questions about the fundamental competence of the design team.


Questions which, when Lifeweaver was launched, were emphatically answered with "No, they really are just a bit thick". LWs defining ability is 'Life grip' which locks out the target's abilities and pulls them to him. It cannot be blocked or denied. Pretty standard moba-style CC right? [i] No, lifegrip can only be used on teammates.[/i]


Very predictably, it is used mostly to grief / troll because overwatch players are literal [i]overwatch[/i] players & is usually unhelpful even when used in earnest. [b] The most recent 'balance' update increases Life grip's lockout duration. [/b]


What is it that Reggie said? 'If its not fun, why bother?' 
Well, I stayed around for OW when a lot of people left for very good reason because I was still having fun.
I am no longer having fun.

I have over 1,300 hours in Overwatch 1, and another ~400 hours in Overwatch 2. Overall - yes, I recommend this game. Especially as a free to play game.

It does have shocking monetisation, and often has frustrating matchmaking, but the core gameplay loop is fantastic. The characters are likeable, the worldbuilding is beautiful, and the game gets updated at least once a month with new things.

I have like 800 collective hours across xbox and pc, I've been playing this since 2015 and I have never seen a game and a company kill itself as hard as Blizzard has. Overwatch makes Read Dead Redemption 2's treatment by Rockstar look like the favorite child. Overwatch is like a box of kittens getting thrown out of a car because the alcoholic owner decided the food wasn't worth the money. It's actually sad because I used to genuinely enjoy this game. Lol rip its joever

anyways play https://store.steampowered.com/app/440/Team_Fortress_2/

Overwatch 1 was great. You earned loot boxes to win random skins all the time with fresh drops of skins regulary offered (Which would be exclusive if you missed it, but made them more valuable as well).

Now you almost never get a free cool skin except that rare once in a while time, and they keep showing you these awesome ones that cost real money... Sure you could earn gold coins and get them with those for roughly 2k, but you can ONLY earn 60 per WEEK.... Battlepass is 1k which is a better deal, but you cannot earn any premium currency in there (You can only earn standard credits to buy cheaper/old stuff).

The characters still feel polished though which is nice, but after all this time, they still can't balance McRee's (Sorry he's Cassidy now) grenade, Sombra needs a full rework, and Roadhog needs a rework too. I've probably missed others, but they recently nerfed turret damage which is good or bad depending on who you are, but it sucks for people that took the time to get used to those characters to deal with a nerf now.  

I have too much ADHD to focus on one character and have a bunch of skins from OW1, so it's fine for me but I hate telling newer players that they unfortunately won't be able to get these cosmetics how I did. If they had to add a battle pass, you'd think they would just copy Fortnite's or several other games with great battlepass options. Or at least be able to earn some premium currency in the battle pass. 

They also nerfed the battle pass in Season 5 onwards. You can earn a Mythic skin at level 80 for one specific character, and it has a few variations to customize it. But since Season 5, they took out other rewards and split that level 80 mythic skin into "3 rewards"..... Just scummy practice and why I have never purchased a battle pass even though it is the best deal if you wish to purchase anything in the game.

You've probably heard of all the PvE issues in other reviews, but I mostly play PvP so it doesn't affect me but it does suck that I can't just play it for free after being such a long time player. And somehow they're charging like $40 bucks for it..... in a PvP game lol.
